A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Full disclosure: I’m not a Star Wars fan boy. I don’t have any issues with how Last Jedi fits in the “canon\,” and I have zero emotional investment in this franchise. Force Awakens and Rogue One were entertaining\, so I figured this would be more of the same. Nope. I’m mystified by the positive reviews. After fifteen minutes I was bored by the lackluster dialogue and predictable\, cliched plot “twists” (oh wait\, you’re telling me that an actress of Laura Dern’s caliber didn’t sign on to be an inept killjoy and instead was revealed to be a wise hero with an important message? Shocked. SHOCKED.) Every element of this this film was clumsy and predictable\, if not outright ridiculous (that casino scene...oof). Seriously\, this movie sucked.
